title: MLC-GCN: Multi-Level Generated Connectome Based GCN for AD Analysis
abstract: arXiv:2408.03358v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Alzheimer's Disease (AD) is a currently incurable neurodegeneartive disease. Accurately detecting AD, especially in the early stage, represents a high research priority. AD is characterized by progressive cognitive impairments that are related to alterations in brain functional connectivity (FC). Based on this association, many studies have been published over the decades using FC and machine learning to differentiate AD from healthy aging. The most recent development in this detection method highlights the use of graph neural network (GNN) as the brain functionality analysis. In this paper, we proposed a stack of spatio-temporal feature extraction and graph generation based AD classification model using resting state fMRI. The proposed multi-level generated connectome (MLC) based graph convolutional network (GCN) (MLC-GCN) contains a multi-graph generation block and a GCN prediction block. tldr: 该文章提出了一种名为MLC-GCN的多层级生成连接体基于图卷积网络（GCN）的阿尔茨海默病（AD）分析模型，该模型首先提取空间-时间特征，然后生成多层级图，并通过GCN进行分类预测，旨在提高早期AD的诊断准确性。
